title: Classes More Than 5 Students
markdown:
# **Classes More Than 5 Students**

## List all classes with more than or equal to 5 students.

### Table Schema
| Column | Type |
|--------|------|
| student | TEXT |
| class | TEXT |

### Example

**Input:**
```
**courses**
+---------+----------+
| student | class    |
+---------+----------+
| A       | Math     |
| B       | English  |
| C       | Math     |
| D       | Biology  |
| E       | Math     |
| F       | Computer |
| G       | Math     |
| H       | Math     |
| I       | Math     |
+---------+----------+
```

**Expected Output:**
```
+-------+
| class |
+-------+
| Math  |
+-------+
```

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE courses(student TEXT, class TEXT); INSERT INTO courses VALUES ('A','Math'),('B','English'),('C','Math'),('D','Biology'),('E','Math'),('F','Computer'),('G','Math'),('H','Math'),('I','Math');
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT class FROM courses GROUP BY class HAVING COUNT(student) >= 5;

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE courses(student TEXT, class TEXT); INSERT INTO courses VALUES ('A','Math'),('B','English');
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT class FROM courses GROUP BY class HAVING COUNT(student) >= 5;

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE courses(student TEXT, class TEXT); INSERT INTO courses VALUES ('A','Math'),('B','Math'),('C','Math'),('D','Math'),('E','Math'),('F','Sci'),('G','Sci'),('H','Sci'),('I','Sci'),('J','Sci');
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT class FROM courses GROUP BY class HAVING COUNT(student) >= 5;
